name: places/ChIJ26h6oQL0wokRDVc6SrfNmog

displayName.text: Success Academy Charter School - Washington Heights Elementary

formattedAddress: 701 Fort Washington Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 701 Fort Washington Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text: Love this school! My daughter has been attending since it open in 2014 and we've been happy ever since. Like any school, it will have their ups and downs but I never can imagine at a tender age of 7, my daughter can answer over 20 math problems of multiplication and division under 1 min! 1 min!!! Is a great chess player, thanks to SA! She is also reading at 5th grade level and already have college in mind. At her age, I didn't know what college was. Thank you SAWH, I pray after our first 4th grade graduation next school year, our location is able to expand and have a middle school as well! #classof2030

originalText.text: This school is horrible. I would give it a zero star if I could. The teachers are amazing but the rules and the way the school runs is disgusting. My son was in kindergarten and still learning what’s right and wrong so he had trouble staying quiet and staying still. So they suspended him every other day. How is this learning? I pulled him out of the school and is doing WAY BETTER. When I pulled my son out I wanted to pull my daughter out but they begged me to not because of how good and smart she is. My daughter, who is well behaved was in class and saw a RAT in class. Some other classmates also saw it but the teacher said they couldn’t talk when they all tried to tell her. She didn’t find out till the END of the day. Something is seriously wrong with this school. They take up all the parking spaces and nobody uses it. The principal has yelled in my face before. She also brought her baby every single day in school WHILE ON THE CLOCK instead of doing her job. She is evil. I can’t believe she’s still running the school.

originalText.text: I can't complain about the teachers in this school; they were excellent. But if your child has a special need, (and not talking about significant disabilities), this is not the right place. This school doesn't advocate for those kinds of children. My son and I are still traumatized by how the principal treat us, which happened three years ago. They wanted the child to be fixed and be perfect in "that perfect school." At that time, I knew parents who have to contact lawyers to keep their kids in that school and get the assistance they needed. The way that they suspend little kids and send them home for days is disgusting. But thanks God, I am a firm advocate of my son's right. I decided to move on to another school where my son's necessities are supplied; a school were teachers, counselors and the principal are compassionate and not just want to make the school looks "perfect”.

originalText.text: The principal in this school is horrible. I called her to communicate about the way my son was getting taught by his teachers and told her I wasn’t sure if I was going to leave my son in the school and was thinking about withdrawing. A month later I find out she withdrew him from the school without my permission. And when I spoke to her about it she said it was already too late and I would need to reapply after my son has been in the school for two years now. Horrible experience, especially the principal, very unprofessional.

originalText.text: They cannot provide the services needed for a child with an IEP. The children learned to read by 1st grade, but the family suffered both mentally and emotionally from the stress. We are transferring out
